newsitem.title: USA: CellPro stem cell expansion system patented.
newsitem.headline: CellPro stem cell expansion system patented.

text.p: CellPro Inc said Friday it was granted a U.S. patent covering its system of stem cell expansion outside of the body.

The system extracts stem cells from the bone marrow and applies different growth factors to cause the cells to multiply. CellPro said stem cell expansion is important for a number of clinical applications, including certain gene therapy applications and the production of dendritic cells, which produce antigens and are under study for use as a cancer vaccine.
Stem cells, found in the bone marrow, are the progenitor cells for the rest of the body and central to the immune system. It is believed boosting their volumes can help the body fight disease.
CellPro said it plans to license the patent on a non-exclusive basis, since it is not financially equipped to pursue all the possible applications of the technology.
